content.description: Enjoyable movement up the center of the obvious arete just left of Kai and Rosie's Cantina.
content.protection: 4 Bolts and shares an anchor with Kai
content.location: The start is on the left side of the arete (Kai is on the right side).

content.description: Climb the orange dihedral with soft rock just to the right of Rosie's Cantina.
content.location: The dihedral just right of Rosie's Cantina.

content.description: A short, left-leaning offwidth (or fist if you have big hands) crack.
content.protection: #4 cam protects the low crux. #3's protect the rest. Bolt anchor out left.
content.location: The crack around the corner to the left of Rosie's Cantina.

content.description: Bolted gritty slab to the right of the Tool Buttress. South facing. The guidebook said it might have been the first bolted route at HCR.
content.location: Walk toward the Roman Wall from the Tool Buttress and keep an eye out for a bolted grey slab.

content.description: Located ten feet to the of It's a Boy! Start below the rounded arete with the low roof. Traverse left under the roof along a finger rail to reach the first bolt. Pull the roof then trend back right up the rounded arete to the anchors.
Begin with a tougher start that leads to large jugs to the top.
content.location: Between Ermagerd and Meh, starts just left of a large tree.*As of 11/2020 the large tree has now fallen.

content.description: Climb mainly jugs to a mantel higher up.
content.location: Between Oakie Dokie and El Regalo, just right of a large tree.

content.description: Blunt arete to slab finish; shares anchors with El Regalo.
content.location: Between El Regalo and Mad Money.

content.description: A bouldery move off of a sidepull leads to a mini ledge with a tricky mantle. From the ledge, continue up easy climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: From the main east side approach trail, pass Magoo Rock and trend left. Take the first branch up right to the cliff. Follow the cliff to the left until you reach a crack with large chockstones. The route is first bolted route to the right of this crack.

content.description: Large jugs lead to a short dihedral like feature at the top of the climb.
content.location: The rightmost line at the Middle East, right of Megatron.

content.description: Scramble up the chockstone filled acute dihedral. Top out through mini chimney to a tree, or traverse right on the face to a small tree.
content.protection: Gear to 4" with a few long slings. Anchor on a large tree 10 feet back, or a small tree 10 feet right.
content.location: The second crack system right of Rosie's Cantina.

content.description: Climb easy terrain to an interesting flake feature that guards the arete. Thoughtful moves follow the arete to the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: From the main east side approach trail, pass Magoo Rock and trend left. Take the first branch up right to the cliff. Follow the cliff to the wide corner crack with bright orange rock. Kai is the second line of bolts to the left of the crack.

content.description: Start fifteen feet left of Dragon Reborn. A high stick clip marks the start of the sequential crux, then finish with fun (9) climbing above.
Nice and interesting movement to the top of the cliff that starts on a boulder near the base.
content.location: Between Dragon Reborn and Oakie Dokie.

content.description: Start in a vague right facing dihedral and move to the top.
Climb up the middle of the steep slab with a balancy crux move above the first bolt and several other interesting moves above.
The rightmost area at the Middle East, this area contains a clustered grouping of routes from 5.7 to 5.11a.
